---
title: "Built-in templates"
date: 2024-12-16
lastmod: 2024-12-19
description: "Information about the built in templates"
sidebar:
  order: 0
---

import { Icon } from "@astrojs/starlight/components";

Heim currently supports applications written in `Rust`, `C#`, `Typescript`, `python` and `C`. When you install Heim, built-in templates are included with your installation.

Read on for descriptions of the built-in templates that will be included in an installation of Heim.

<br />

:::tip[Using templates]
Check out our [_Getting Started_](./../../start-here/getting-started/#using-applications/) document, for general information about working with applications in Heim, and how to use a template to create a new application.
:::

<br />

---

<br />

## <Icon name="seti:rust" label="Rust language icon" class="inline-icon" /> Rust

### rust-http

A minimal Rust component, ready to deploy an `HTTP function`

<br />

**inputs:**

| name                  | description                                                      |
| --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `http_trigger_path`   | trigger path the default application component will listen on    |
| `http_trigger_method` | the HTTP method the default application component will listen on |

<br />

:::tip[Guide]
This template has its own written guide, which you can find [here](./../../guides/examples/basic-rust-application/).
:::

<br />

---

<br />

## <Icon name="seti:c-sharp" label="C# language icon" class="inline-icon" /> C-Sharp

### csharp-http

A minimal C# component, ready to deploy an `HTTP function`.
Requires **dotnet 9**!

<br />

**inputs:**

| name                  | description                                                      |
| --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `http_trigger_path`   | trigger path the default application component will listen on    |
| `http_trigger_method` | the HTTP method the default application component will listen on |

<br />

:::tip[Guide]
This template has its own written guide, which you can find [here](./../../guides/examples/basic-csharp-application/).
:::

## <br/>

<br />

### csharp-http-async

A minimal C# async component, ready to deploy an `HTTP function`, where you can include almost all external C# libraries
Requires **dotnet 10 preview** or later!

<br />

**inputs:**

| name                  | description                                                      |
| --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `http_trigger_path`   | trigger path the default application component will listen on    |
| `http_trigger_method` | the HTTP method the default application component will listen on |

<br />

---

<br />

## <Icon name="seti:python" label="Python language icon" class="inline-icon" /> Python

### python-http

A minimal Python component, ready to deploy an `HTTP function`.

<br />

**inputs:**

| name                  | description                                                      |
| --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `http_trigger_path`   | trigger path the default application component will listen on    |
| `http_trigger_method` | the HTTP method the default application component will listen on |

<br />

:::tip[Guide]
This template has its own written guide, which you can find [here](./../../guides/examples/basic-python-application/).
:::

<br />

### typescript-http

A minimal Typescript component, ready to deploy an `HTTP function`.

**inputs:**

| --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- |

### c-http

A minimal C application, ready to deploy an `HTTP function`

<br />

**inputs:**

| name                  | description                                                      |
| --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `http_trigger_path`   | trigger path the default application component will listen on    |

## <Icon name="seti:go" label="Go language icon" class="inline-icon" /> Go

### Go-http

A minimal Go application, ready to deploy an `HTTP function`

<br />

**inputs:**

| name                  | description                                                      |
| --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `http_trigger_path`   | trigger path the default application component will listen on    |
| `http_trigger_method` | the HTTP method the default application component will listen on |

<br />

:::tip[Guide]
This template has its own written guide, which you can find [here](./../../guides/examples/basic-go-application/).
:::

## OpenAPI 

Generates a Csharp or rust-http project based on a OpenAPI-specification.
See limitations of our current version of the [OpenAPI-template](./../openapi/).
<br />

**inputs:**

| name                     | description                                                               |
| ------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `OpenAPI-specification`  | path or url to the openapi-specification (Yaml/Json)                      |
| `Project name`           | name of the generated project                                             |
| `Version`                | version-number for the project (defaults to specification version-number) |
| `Base-path`              | base-path for the all paths specified in the specification                |

<br />
